Description: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS TO COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN HAWAII. THE WATER SAMPLES WILL BE TESTED FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC WILL BE NOTIFIED WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND WHEN THEY ARE SAFE FOR SWIMMING. THESE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $319,687.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THEIR BEACH MONITORING PROGRAM FOR THE UPCOMING SWIMMING SEASON, INCLUDING MEETING PERFORMANCE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY FEDERAL BEACH ACT TO REMAIN ELIGIBLE FOR THE BEACH GRANT. IT WILL FUND THEIR EFFORTS TO MONITOR WATER QUALITY AT DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN CALIFORNIA.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $525,000.ACTIVITIES:THE MONITORING AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM WILL CONSIST OF BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY MONITORING AT RECREATIONAL BATHING BEACHES, PUBLIC NOTIFICATION AND RISK COMMUNICATION OF THE SAMPLE RESULTS, MEASURES TO NOTIFY EPA, AND A PUBLIC EVALUATION COMPONENT. THE GRANTEE WILL NOTIFY THE PUBLIC OF A WATER QUALITY EXCEEDANCE BY ISSUING AN ADVISORY OR CLOSURE. THIS PROGRAM WILL BE CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL BEACH GUIDANCE PUBLISHED AT THE TIME OF GRANT AWARD.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SUBMISSIONS OF WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION ACTIONS AND AN ANNUAL SUMMARY REPORT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE SWIMMER ILLNESS BY PROVIDING THE PUBLIC WITH BACTERIOLOGICAL INFORMATION SO THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT WHICH BEACHES TO ATTEND. BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL RESIDENTS AND TOURISTS THAT VISIT THE BEACHES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE STATE OF VIRGINIA'S EFFORTS IN COLLECTING WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE TESTING OF WATER SAMPLES FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY; PUBLIC NOTIFICATION WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS OR APPLICABLE BEACH ACTION VALUES; AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION WHEN THE BEACHES ARE SAFE FOR SWIMMING. FROM AN ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS STANDPOINT, THESE SAMPLING AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.

BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT ARE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO THE RECREATIONAL BEACHES WITHIN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS TO COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN MARYLAND. THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE BEACH MONITORING PROGRAM FOR THE UPCOMING SWIMMING SEASON, INCLUDING MEETING PERFORMANCE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY FEDERAL BEACH ACT TO REMAIN ELIGIBLE FOR THE BEACH GRANT.  THE WATER SAMPLES WILL BE TESTED FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC WILL BE NOTIFIED WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS OR BEACH NOTIFICATION THRESHOLD AND WHEN THEY ARE NOT SAFE FOR SWIMMING. THESE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.
ACTIVITIES:THE MONITORING AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM WILL CONSIST OF BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY MONITORING AT RECREATIONAL BATHING BEACHES, PUBLIC NOTIFICATION AND RISK COMMUNICATION OF THE SAMPLE RESULTS, MEASURES TO NOTIFY EPA, AND A PUBLIC EVALUATION COMPONENT. THE GRANTEE WILL NOTIFY THE PUBLIC OF A WATER QUALITY EXCEEDANCE BY ISSUING AN ADVISORY OR CLOSURE. THIS PROGRAM WILL BE CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL BEACH GUIDANCE PUBLISHED AT THE TIME OF GRANT AWARD.SUBRECIPIENT:LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS WILL CONDUCT BEACH WATER QUALITY SAMPLING AND MONITORING AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION AT BATHING BEACHES IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SUBMISSIONS OF WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION ACTIONS AND AN ANNUAL SUMMARY REPORT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE SWIMMER ILLNESS BY PROVIDING THE PUBLIC WITH BACTERIOLOGICAL INFORMATION SO THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT WHICH BEACHES TO ATTEND. BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL RESIDENTS AND TOURISTS THAT VISIT THE BEACHES IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND.

OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES FOR FY22 WILL BE:
DURING THE BEACH MONITORING SEASON, APPROXIMATELY 20 BEACHES WILL BE MONITORED MONTHLY. MARINE WATER AT SELECTED BEACHES WILL BE SAMPLED FOR THE INDICATOR ORGANISM, ENTEROCOCCUS. PUBLIC HEALTH ADVISORIES WILL BE ISSUED WHEN FECAL BACTERIA LEVELS ARE ABOVE THE ADOPTED BAV OF 130 MPN OF MARINE WATER. PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ABOUT THE PROGRAM AND BEACH SAFETY WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH OHA'S WEBSITE, PHONE CALLS, EMAILS, MAILINGS AND THE MEDIA. OBMP WILL CONDUCT OFF-SEASON INVESTIGATIONAL SAMPLING AS RESOURCES ALLOW. OBMP WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS CONDUCTING OR PLANNING INVESTIGATIONAL WATER SAMPLING PROJECTS. ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REPORT WILL BE SUBMITTED BY JANUARY 31 FOLLOWING EACH BEACH MONITORING SEASON.

THE LONG-TERM OUTCOMES FOR THIS GRANT INCLUDE INFORMED AND UP-TO-DATE COASTAL STAKEHOLDERS; IMPROVED PUBLIC AWARENESS OF BEACH WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS; REDUCED FECAL BACTERIA LEVELS IN COASTAL WATERS AND WATERS SAFE FOR SWIMMING THROUGH POTENTIAL IMPROVEMENTS IN SEWER AND SEPTIC SERVICES, AND STORM WATER RUNOFF; AND REDUCED LEVELS OF ILLNESS RELATED TO COASTAL WATER QUALITY.

ADEC WILL RUN CONCURRENT TO MONITORING, DEC WILL RUN THE VIRTUAL BEACH MODEL FOR KENAI AND KETCHIKAN.2) DATA REVIEW , SUBMIT AND AND QA OF AWQMS SYSTEM DATA. 3) FALL REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS AND SUB-AWARD PROJECTS. AND  4) VALIDATE VIRTUAL BEACH MODEL

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO FUND THE APPLICANT'S EFFORTS TO COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN CONNECTICUT. THE WATER SAMPLES WILL BE TESTED FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC WILL BE NOTIFIED WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND WHEN THEY ARE SAFE FOR SWIMMING. THESE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.ACTIVITIES:CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (CT DPH) WILL MONITOR DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN CONNECTICUT FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND NOTIFY THE PUBLIC WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS. THE PROJECT CONTINUES THE WORK OF CT DPH TO IMPLEMENT ITS STATEWIDE COASTAL BEACH MONITORING, ASSESSMENT, AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM UNDER THE FEDERAL BEACH ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: MONITORING AND ANALYSIS OF INDICATOR BACTERIA AT COASTAL BEACHES; MAINTAINING AND OPERATING A PUBLIC NOTIFICATION SYSTEM; IMPROVING LABORATORY CAPABILITY AND WEB-BASED DATA SYSTEMS, INCLUDING GIS COVERAGE; PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES TO ASSESS POLLUTION SOURCES AT SPECIFIC BEACHES; AND ANNUALLY REPORTING TO EPA THE RESULTS OF MONITORING AND NOTIFICATION ACTIONS ELECTRONICALLY AND IN AN EPA-SPECIFIED FORMAT.SUBRECIPIENT:CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (CT DPH) HAS A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (CT DEEP) FOR THE MONITORING AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION AT STATE PARK BEACHES.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPORTING CONSISTENT WITH EPA AND BEACH PROGRAM GUIDANCE AND SCHEDULES ON WATER SAMPLING AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS. THE APPLICANT WILL ALSO SUBMIT BEACH MONITORING DATA TO EPA IN AN EPA-SPECIFIED FORMAT. BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL RESIDENTS AND TOURISTS THAT VISIT THE MARINE BEACHES IN CONNECTICUT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO FUND THE APPLICANT'S EFFORTS TO COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN MAINE. THE WATER SAMPLES WILL BE TESTED FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC WILL BE NOTIFIED WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND WHEN THEY ARE SAFE FOR SWIMMING. THESE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.ACTIVITIES:MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (ME DEP) WILL MONITOR DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN MAINE FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND NOTIFY THE PUBLIC WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS. ME DEP WILL SUBMIT MONITORING AND WATER QUALITY DATA TO EPA.SUBRECIPIENT:THIS SUBAWARD WILL FUND AN AMERICORPS ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARD, WHO WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SAMPLE COLLECTION AT SELECT RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN MAINE.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPORTING CONSISTENT WITH EPA AND BEACH PROGRAM GUIDANCE AND SCHEDULES ON WATER SAMPLING AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS. THE APPLICANT WILL ALSO SUBMIT BEACH MONITORING DATA TO EPA IN AN EPA-APPROVED FORMAT. BENEFICIARIES OF THE APPLICANT'S EFFORTS INCLUDE ALL VISITORS TO RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S BEACH MONITORING PROGRAM FOR THE UPCOMING SWIMMING SEASON, INCLUDING MEETING PERFORMANCE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY FEDERAL BEACH ACT TO REMAIN ELIGIBLE FOR THE BEACH GRANT. IT WILL FUND THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS TO MONITOR WATER QUALITY AT DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN RHODE ISLAND AND TO NOTIFY THE PUBLIC WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE BEACH NOTIFICATION THRESHOLD FOR BACTERIA.ACTIVITIES:THE MONITORING AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM WILL CONSIST OF BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY MONITORING AT RECREATIONAL BATHING BEACHES, PUBLIC NOTIFICATION AND RISK COMMUNICATION OF THE SAMPLE RESULTS, MEASURES TO NOTIFY EPA, AND A PUBLIC EVALUATION COMPONENT. THE GRANTEE WILL NOTIFY THE PUBLIC OF A WATER QUALITY EXCEEDANCE BY ISSUING AN ADVISORY OR CLOSURE. THIS PROGRAM WILL BE CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL BEACH GUIDANCE PUBLISHED AT THE TIME OF GRANT AWARD.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SUBMISSIONS OF WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION ACTIONS AND AN ANNUAL SUMMARY REPORT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE SWIMMER ILLNESS BY PROVIDING THE PUBLIC WITH BACTERIOLOGICAL INFORMATION SO THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT WHICH BEACHES TO VISIT. BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL RESIDENTS AND TOURISTS THAT VISIT THE BEACHES.

THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (CT DPH) EFFORTS TO COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FROM DESIGNATED RECREATIONAL BEACHES IN CONNECTICUT (CT).  THE WATER SAMPLES WILL BE TESTED FOR BACTERIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY AND THE PUBLIC WILL BE NOTIFIED WHEN THE WATERS EXCEED THE APPLICABLE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND WHEN THEY ARE SAFE FOR SWIMMING. THE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION EFFORTS WILL PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY REDUCING THE RISK TO THE BATHING PUBLIC OF CONTRACTING DISEASES FROM CONTAMINATED WATER.
